summary: Fix skills progress bar animation flicker by removing the problematic 300ms setTimeout and ensuring proper initial state. The issue occurs because progress bars start with an undefined width, get animated via CSS transitions, but the 300ms delay in JavaScript causes a visual glitch where bars appear to move backwards before completing their animation.

action_plan.description: Analyze current animation flow and identify the root cause of the flicker in the animateSkillBar function
Ensure progress bars start with 0% width by adding initial CSS styling to prevent undefined initial state
Remove the 300ms setTimeout from animateSkillBar function and implement immediate width setting with proper CSS transition handling
Add a small delay using requestAnimationFrame to ensure DOM is ready before triggering the animation, replacing the arbitrary timeout
Test the animation locally by running the portfolio website and scrolling to the skills section to verify smooth animation without flicker
Verify the fix works across different browsers and screen sizes, ensuring the animation is consistent

risks: Animation timing might need fine-tuning to maintain smooth visual effect
CSS transition duration may need adjustment to work well with the new JavaScript timing
Browser compatibility issues with requestAnimationFrame vs setTimeout approach
Intersection Observer timing might conflict with immediate animation trigger
dependencies: Existing CSS transition system in main.css
Intersection Observer API for scroll-triggered animations
issue_title: Bug: Skills progress bars flicker and move backwards during animation
